review: I have a Roku, but was considering buying the Amazon Fire TV. But after reading all the negative reviews and my own experience with using Amazon Prime with my Roku, I decided against purchasing the Fire TV.When I go into Amazon Prime from my Roku, I look for a movie or TV show that has a "CC" on the bottom because I watch many British shows and need the closed captions to understand much of the dialog. However, I have gone into many shows that indicate "CC"; I turn CC ON, but I get no closed captions--this happens most of the time. And as one reviewer noted, there's no way to see Amazon Prime  shows only.So I'll stick  to my Roku until such time as Amazon surpasses them.

review: The Fire is replacing an older Roku box I've been using for 5+ years. The Fire looks good and feels very solid. Had it connected and running in 5 minutes. Everything has worked perfectly so far (30 minutes of use - lol). Hopefully it will continue to work this well for years to come.Just ordered a second unit for the bedroom. Been using the Fire for a two days now. The Fire is faster than the old Roku boxes. I do have to say that I'm only accessing Amz Prime and Pandora. Tried a couple of apps and they connected fine, just won't use them much.
